H0.text: Valence is the sum of protons and neutrons in the nucleus of an atom.

H1.text: Mass number is the sum of protons and neutrons in the nucleus of an atom.

H2.text: Chemical property is the sum of protons and neutrons in the nucleus of an atom.

H3.text: Electrical charge is the sum of protons and neutrons in the nucleus of an atom.

A4.text: The mass number (symbol A, from the German word: Atomgewicht, 'atomic weight'), also called atomic mass number or nucleon number, is the total number of protons and neutrons (together known as nucleons) in an atomic nucleus.

A5.text: Since protons and neutrons are both baryons, the mass number A is identical with the baryon number B of the nucleus (and also of the whole atom or ion).
